content:
• Tuesday, May 7, 2013
  • PXD

    Pioneer Southwest Energy Partners (PSE) +19.4% AH after Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD)...

    Pioneer Southwest Energy Partners (PSE) +19.4% AH after Pioneer Natural Resources (NYSE:PXD) proposes to buy all outstanding shares it doesn't already own through a stock-for-unit exchange that values PSE at ~$1.1B. PXD currently owns ~52.4% of the 35.7M-plus outstanding common units of the limited partnership.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:16 PM
  • MRO

    More on Marathon Oil's (NYSE:MRO) Q1 results: Earnings fell 8.2% Y/Y as $1.03B was set...

    More on Marathon Oil's (NYSE:MRO) Q1 results: Earnings fell 8.2% Y/Y as $1.03B was set aside for income taxes, masking a slight rise in revenue to $4.1B. Operating margins grew to 36% from 34.5%. Oil and gas for sale excluding Libya averaged 427K boe/day, at the top end of its estimate of 415K-430K boe/day. Raises 2013 production growth target to 7%-10%. Shares -1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • RKUS

    Though Ruckus (RKUS -26.2%) claims its Q1 miss and soft guidance aren't tied to competition, "it...

    Though Ruckus (RKUS -26.2%) claims its Q1 miss and soft guidance aren't tied to competition, "it is difficult to reconcile the implied disparity between Ruckus’ growth and that of the overall [carrier] Wi-Fi market," says Lazard, discussing its downgrade to Neutral. However, other companies, such as F5 and Fortinet, have also reported soft carrier demand for discretionary projects. Meanwhile, Raymond James thinks Ruckus and Aruba's (ARUN -22.8% - previous) warnings, along with Motorola Solutions' (NYSE:MSI) guidance, suggests enterprise Wi-Fi growth is slowing.  Market leader Cisco (CSCO -2%), whose Wi-Fi unit posted 27% Y/Y growth last quarter, reports on May 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:02 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYMC

    Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC) -6.2% AH after guiding on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue of $1.61B-$1.65B...

    Symantec (NASDAQ:SYMC) -6.2% AH after guiding on its FQ4 call for FQ1 revenue of $1.61B-$1.65B and EPS of $0.35-$0.36, below a consensus of $1.7B and $0.44. Symantec is also forecasting FY14 EPS growth of 5%-7%, below a consensus of 8.5%. Are share losses to upstarts such as CommVault (NASDAQ:CVLT) and Veeam taking a toll? Today, CommVault posted an FQ4 beat on the back of 21% Y/Y rev. growth, and stated on its earnings call it's comfortable with the Street's revenue forecasts (consensus is for 15% growth). Of course, CommVault also said it's worried about an "apparent near-term slowdown in tech spending" (many peers would concur).
     
     
     
     
    | 6:38 PM
  • WMB

    More on Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) Q1 results: The 62% drop in Q1 earnings is attributed to a 50%...

    More on Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) Q1 results: The 62% drop in Q1 earnings is attributed to a 50% decline in natural gas liquids margins at Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ). Issues downside guidance, seeing EPS of $0.72 vs. $1.00 consensus for FY 2013 and $1.30 vs. $1.40 consensus for 2014. WPZ lowers 2013-14 guidance for earnings and distributable cash flow. WMB -3.4%, WPZ +0.2% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM
  • EA

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) now +7.7% AH as better-than-feared FY14 guidance overshadows an FQ4...

    Electronic Arts (NASDAQ:EA) now +7.7% AH as better-than-feared FY14 guidance overshadows an FQ4 EPS miss. Activision (NASDAQ:ATVI) +1.1%. EA's "Digital' revenue (inc. downloads, subscriptions, ad sales, etc.) rose 45% Y/Y to $618M, while packaged goods/other revenue fell 25% to $396M. Consoles 65% of net revenue (66% a year ago), PCs 21% (25% prior), mobile 9% (6% prior), handhelds 3% (1% prior). Free cash flow was $208M vs. net income of $169M. Battlefield 3 Premium subs rose by 600K to 3.5M. The Simpsons: Tapped Out produced almost $10M in net revenue in March; Real Racing 3 is also doing well on iOS. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:52 PM
  • PXD

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: PSE +20%. WBMD +14%. ARAY +12%. EA +9%. WFM +7.7%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:30 p.m.: PSE +20%. WBMD +14%. ARAY +12%. EA +9%. WFM +7.7%.
    After-hours top losers: VCLK -14%. RBCN -12%. SYNC -12%. CORE -7%. CIE -7%.

  • RBCN

    Following a halt, Rubicon (NASDAQ:RBCN) -11.3% AH after posting mixed Q1 results, and guiding...

    Following a halt, Rubicon (NASDAQ:RBCN) -11.3% AH after posting mixed Q1 results, and guiding for Q2 revenue of $10M-$12M and EPS of -$0.19 to -$0.23. The former is in-line with a $10.6M consensus, but the latter is below expectations of -$0.08. Rubicon states LED wafer pricing remains weak (prices for 2"-4" wafers, while improving, remain below total cost), as does demand for 6" wafers (partly responsible for light Q1 guidance in Feb.) as customers burn through inventory. Rubicon's Q1 gross margin was -40.6%, and from the looks of things, it won't be getting much (if any) better in Q2. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:23 PM

    Cobalt Energy (NYSE:CIE) -6.7% AH after announcing a public offering of 50M shares of its common stock, all of which will be offered by selling stockholders. CIE will receive no proceeds from the offering.

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Synacor (SYNC - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $26.5M-$27.5M, below a...

    Tech guidance roundup: 1) Synacor (SYNC - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $26.5M-$27.5M, below a $30.6M consensus. Expects 2013 revenue of $122M-$126M vs. $123.1M consensus. 2) ValueClick (VCLK - earnings) expects Q2 revenue of $164M-$168M and EPS of $0.38-$0.40, below a consensus of $175.6M and $0.41. Buyback program increased by $61M to $150M. 3) CA (CA - earnings) expects FY14 (ends March '14) revenue of $4.43B-$4.52B and EPS of $2.35-$2.43, mostly below consensus of $4.63B and $2.42. Restructuring announced: 1,200 jobs to be cut, $150M in charges. SYNC -11.3% AH. VCLK -11.8%. CA -4.6%. (Synacor PR) (ValueClick PR) (CA PR)

  • WBMD

    More on WebMD: Anthony Vuolo is being replaced as CFO by finance SVP Peter Anevski, but will...

    More on WebMD: Anthony Vuolo is being replaced as CFO by finance SVP Peter Anevski, but will remain with the company as an SVP "focusing on strategic projects." Cavan Redmond is also leaving the board. No explanation is given for the CEO/CFO changes, which are accompanied by very strong results and guidance. Monthly unique users +23% Y/Y to 132M, total page views +10% to 2.78B. WBMD +9.6% AH to a new 52-week high. CC getting started (webcast). (PR)

    More on Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN): FQ3 beats across the board on a 12% Y/Y increase in...

    More on Myriad Genetics (NASDAQ:MYGN): FQ3 beats across the board on a 12% Y/Y increase in revenue. Molecular diagnostic testing revenue rose +20% over the prior year, while revenue from its BRACAnalysis test, which represented 74% of total revenue, grew by 9%. Operating income +26%, while operating margin rose to 37% from 35.5%. Shares +2.5% AH.

    Javelin Mortgage (NYSE:JMI) announces a whopper of a secondary - 6M shares (with underwriters granted an option for another 900K) against a current float of 7.5M. The company last night reported March 31 book value of $18.40/share against today's closing stock price of $19.98. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)

Shares -4.7% AH. (PR)

Closing stock price today of $11.59. Net interest spread of 2.9%, unchanged from Q4. Shares +3.5% AH. Earnings call tomorrow at 9 ET. (PR)

    WebMd (NASDAQ:WBMD): Q1 EPS of -$0.03 beats by $0.12. Revenue of $112.8M (+6% Y/Y) beats by $6.2M. Expects Q2 revenue above $115M, higher than consensus of $107.9M. Expects 2013 revenue of $450M-$470M and EPS of -$0.26 to -$0.03, above consensus of $444M and -$0.30. CEO Cavan Raymond is leaving, effective immediately. Former SVP David Schlanger has been named interim CEO while the board searches for a full-time replacement. Shares +5.1% AH. (PR)

  • JCP

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) reports preliminary Q1 revenue of $2.635B, a mark which sits just short...

    J.C. Penney (NYSE:JCP) reports preliminary Q1 revenue of $2.635B, a mark which sits just short of the consensus estimate of analysts. A comparable store sales decline of 16.6% during the quarter is actually an improvement, but the retailer is starting to run up against soft comps. JCP +2.3% AH to $16.77 as the quarter for the retailer has some appearances of a bottoming out of the sales plunge with more home goods on tap for Q2.

    More on Whole Foods Markets' (WFM) FQ2: Comparable store sales were up 8.9% Y/Y during the...

    More on Whole Foods Markets' (WFM) FQ2: Comparable store sales were up 8.9% Y/Y during the period, while the two-year comp rose over 17%. The firm sees FY13 EPS of $2.86-$2.89, up from its prior estimate of $2.83-$2.87. Store opening guidance is for 32 in new stores in FY13 and 33-38 in FY14. A 2-for-1 stock split is set. Shares +7.8% AH. (PR)

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP -1%) says it's licensed pending patents related to the use of...

    Raptor Pharmaceutical (RPTP -1%) says it's licensed pending patents related to the use of cysteamine for the treatment of Rett syndrome and associated disorders of methyl-CpG binding protein 2. Under terms of the agreement, RPTP will receive exclusive global rights to develop and commercialize cysteamine and related compounds to treat diseases associated with the disorder.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • VALE

    Vale (VALE +3%) says it hasn't been contacted by ThyssenKrupp about a reported proposal to...

    Vale (VALE +3%) says it hasn't been contacted by ThyssenKrupp about a reported proposal to increase its stake in a troubled Brazilian steel mill. The German steelmaker is seeking to sell two plants in the Americas, including one near Rio de Janeiro in which Vale has a 27% stake. One proposal was said to have Vale increasing its stake in the mill to 33%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • AFFY

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +38%) soar today on heavy volume with no real catalyst to explain...

    Shares of Affymax (OTC:AFFY +38%) soar today on heavy volume with no real catalyst to explain the move. The stock was hammered earlier this year after the company recalled its Omontys injections, and since then the shares are lower by about 95%. So, when you look at today's move with a somewhat wider lens, it really hardly registers on the radar. One positive source being credited with exacerbating the move is a Seeking Alpha article that calls the biotech potentially the best reversal play for 2013, though the stock was in play prior to the piece's appearance.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM | 1 Comment

    Gramercy Property Trust (GPT +1%) moves about 3% off the session low as the earnings...

    Gramercy Property Trust (GPT +1%) moves about 3% off the session low as the earnings call/business plan update reveals a management focused and executing on its plan to turn the company into a pure play equity REIT. The implied cap rate (pg. 27-31) of net lease companies (O, WPC, NNN, LXP, EPR, SRC, ARCP,GTY) of 5%-6.5% is far below the 7.5%-8.5% Gramercy is closing deals at - "(the) widest arbitrage in our experience."

    Recent IPO GW Pharmaceuticals (GWPH -0.9%) says it's received commercialization approval for its...

    Recent IPO GW Pharmaceuticals (GWPH -0.9%) says it's received commercialization approval for its prescription medicine Sativex in Italy. Sativex is a treatment for moderate to severe spasticity in Multiple Sclerosis patients who have not responded adequately to other anti-spasticity medications.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM
  • EMR

    Emerson Electric (EMR -1.6%) dips after its FQ2 misses on all counts this morning. Net earnings...

    Emerson Electric (EMR -1.6%) dips after its FQ2 misses on all counts this morning. Net earnings rose 2.9% Y/Y as overall revenue was boosted by stronger process-management and climate-technology sales, but the company said in its call that orders in April continued to trend downward for a third month, reflecting ongoing deterioration in business confidence. Based on that view, the company lowered its FY13 outlook, now expecting $3.48 to $3.58 per share in earnings and sales growth of 1.5% to 2.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • EOG

    EOG Resources (EOG +7.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $150 price target at Stifel...

    EOG Resources (EOG +7.7%) is upgraded to Buy from Hold with a $150 price target at Stifel Nicolaus following a strong Q1 report. The firm believes the drivers behind the Q1 beat will result in 2013 production growth coming in at the high end of EOG's unchanged production guidance range, improved 2014 outlooks, and approaching neutral free cash flow sooner than previously expected.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +0.2%) will not boost its offer for Plains Exploration (PXP +1.6%),...

    Freeport McMoRan (FCX +0.2%) will not boost its offer for Plains Exploration (PXP +1.6%), according to sources cited by Dealreporter. Earlier today, ISS recommended shareholders vote against the deal as it believes the stock should trade higher based on intrinsic value alone.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM
  • CFX

    Shares of Colfax (CFX -2.4%) slip today after the company said late Monday that it and BDT...

    Shares of Colfax (CFX -2.4%) slip today after the company said late Monday that it and BDT Capital Partners plan to sell a total of about 10M shares between them. CFX will offer 7M shares to raise money for general purposes that may include acquisitions, or paying down debt, while BDT will offer 3M. The underwriters will also have a 30-day option to purchase up to an additional 500K shares from Colfax and up to an additional 1M shares from BDT Capital. Deutsche Bank is the sole book-runner.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM
  • P

    Pandora (P -4.6%) slides after releasing April audience metrics that suggest its 40-hour mobile...

    Pandora (P -4.6%) slides after releasing April audience metrics that suggest its 40-hour mobile monthly listening cap is taking a toll. Listener hour growth of 24% Y/Y (to 1.31B) represents a sharp slowdown from March's 40%, and Pandora's share of U.S. radio listening fell to 7.33% from March's 8.05% (it's up from the year-ago period's 5.95%). Active listeners totaled 70.1M, up 35% Y/Y but only 1% M/M - that last figure suggests slowing U.S. smartphone market growth and/or competition from the likes of Spotify, TuneIn, and Songza might also be having an effect. FQ1 results arrive on May 23; shares are still up 53% YTD following a well-received FQ4 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 4 Comments
  • REED

    Reed's (REED +18.1%) bubbles higher after the natural soda maker says Q1 revenues rose 24% Y/Y...

    Reed's (REED +18.1%) bubbles higher after the natural soda maker says Q1 revenues rose 24% Y/Y to $8M, exceeding internal goals and outpacing 2012's average of 20% revenue growth across product lines. The company will report next Tuesday.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 5 Comments
  • HMY

    Some big moves in today’s options trading make it appear that investors are banking on...

    Some big moves in today’s options trading make it appear that investors are banking on another drop in the gold miners ETF (GDX -3%), already -36% YTD. Volume in GDX options is heaviest in the June $27 strike puts, where nearly 40K puts have traded vs. open interest of ~16K contracts. Big miners are broadly lower: HMY -5.5%, GFI -5.2%, AU -3.2%, ABX -3.1%, EGO -2.8%, NEM -2.2%, GG -2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM | 3 Comments
  • RALY

    Rally Software (RALY -3.5%) doesn't on underwriter coverage day, even though all four firms...

    Rally Software (RALY -3.5%) doesn't on underwriter coverage day, even though all four firms issuing reports have established bullish stances. Needham (Buy) argues Rally is well-positioned for strong growth in an agile software development tool market featuring 6M-8M potential seats, and in which Rally has sold only 168K seats thus far. The firm notes the growing preference for agile development, which can improve time-to-market, relative to traditional methods. Rally is up 34% from its April IPO price of $14.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM
  • BAX

    53% of voting shareholders supported CalSTRS and Relational Investors' proposal to spinoff...

    53% of voting shareholders supported CalSTRS and Relational Investors' proposal to spinoff Timken's (TKR +2.8%) steel business, an idea the company has repeatedly criticized for undervaluing synergies and being generally "misguided" (I, II, III). The proposal received the support of proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis & Co. last month and many believe the combined market cap of the two separate firms (bearings and steel) would be greater than that of the conglomerate. The proposal is non-binding and TKR says it will "evaluate" shareholders' views and "take steps" within 45 days. All 12 board members were re-elected.
